xqc package¶

Submodules¶

xqc.baseops module¶

class xqc.baseops.Op(arr: Array, subs=None)¶

Bases: object

The class Op will serve as the base class of quantum objects for this library. It stores the information about the array, the shape of the array, and the subsystem decomposition of the array if there is a tensor product structure to the problem.

args arr: A jax array that is square in shape subs: The subsystem structure submitted as a jax array with the shape [[n1 x n1], [n2, n2], …, [nN, nN]]. If None, the system is considered as a single system with structure [n x n].

T()¶
conj()¶
dag()¶
eigs()¶
tr()¶
tree_flatten()¶
classmethod tree_unflatten(aux_data, children)¶
xqc.baseops.acomm(op1: Op, op2: Op) → Op¶

Anti-commutator of two Op objects :param op1: First Op object. :param op2: Second Op object. :return: New Op object constructed out of the anti-commutator of the two sent in.

xqc.baseops.comm(op1: Op, op2: Op) → Op¶

Commutator of two Op objects :param op1: First Op object. :param op2: Second Op object. :return: New Op object constructed out of the commutator of the two sent in.

xqc.baseops.id2() → Op¶

This function constructs a 2x2 identity matrix as an Op object in the computational (z) basis. :return: 2x2 identity matrix in the computational (z) basis.

xqc.baseops.ptr(op: Op, keep: Array) → Op¶

Calculate the partial trace of a density matrix given an array of the subsystems to retain.

Parameters:

  • op – Op object with a subsystem structure

  • keep – A 1-D jax array that indexes the subsystems to retain

Returns:

The reduced operator as an Op object and the updated subsystem structure.

xqc.baseops.su(n)¶

Generate a basis for the operator space of 2**n dimensions (Pauli basis). :param n: number of 2-level systems :return: the basis as a jax.numpy array

xqc.baseops.sx() → Op¶

This function constructs a 2x2 pauli-x matrix as an Op object in the computational (z) basis. :return: 2x2 pauli-x matrix in the computational (z) basis.

xqc.baseops.sy() → Op¶

This function constructs a 2x2 pauli-y matrix as an Op object in the computational (z) basis. :return: 2x2 pauli-y matrix in the computational (z) basis.

xqc.baseops.sz() → Op¶

This function constructs a 2x2 Pauli-Z matrix as an Op object in the computational (z) basis. :return: 2x2 Pauli-Z matrix in the computational (z) basis.

xqc.baseops.tensor(op1: Op, op2: Op) → Op¶

Takes in two Op objects with a subsystem structure and takes a kronecker product in the order of input. The function returns the larger array with the updated subsystem structure. :param op1: First Op object with a subsystem structure sub1. :param op2: Second Op object with a subsystem structure sub2. :return: New Op object with the updated subsystem structure [sub1[:], sub2[:]]

xqc.baseops.tr(op: Op)¶
Parameters:

op – Input Op object

Returns:

Trace of the operator of the Op object returned as a complex number.

xqc.hamiltonian module¶

class xqc.hamiltonian.Hamiltonian(coefs, ops)¶

Bases: object

Represents a Hamiltonian as a linear combination of Op objects. :param coefs: Coefficients for each term in the Hamiltonian. :type coefs: array-like :param ops: Operators corresponding to each coefficient. :type ops: sequence of Op :param The Hamiltonian is stored internally as an Op (self.ht) that: :param represents the sum ∑_i coef_i * op_i. All arithmetic operations: :param delegate to the underlying Op: :param preserving JAX compatibility.:

T()¶
conj()¶
dag()¶
eigs()¶
classmethod from_op(op)¶

Create a Hamiltonian directly from an existing Op.

property operator¶

Underlying JAX array of the Hamiltonian.

property subs¶

Subsystem decomposition of the Hamiltonian.

tr()¶

xqc.solvers module¶

Solvers module for the XQC library.

This module provides placeholder classes for future solver implementations.

class xqc.solvers.Solver¶

Bases: object

Base class for solvers.

Subclasses should implement the solve() method to solve a quantum problem using the provided operators and coefficients.

solve(*args, **kwargs)¶

Solve a quantum problem.

This method should be overridden by subclasses to provide a concrete solving algorithm.
